title: Strong Jobs Report Points to Likely Fed Rate Rises in March and May
sub_head: Hiring shrugs off Covid-19 case spike and underscores tightening labor markets
body:
A steady gain in hiring last month keeps the Federal Reserve on track to lift interest rates next month and could prompt increases at meetings in May and June.
Fed officials had already signaled they were prepared to look past Fridayâ€™s report amid fears of a hiring slowdown from the Omicron variant of the coronavirus, which surged across the U.S. last month. Instead, the report showed surprising strength in hiring, not just last month, but over the past several months.
